TopicTitle: Wobbly ships. Probably been report before But perhaps More info will help.

Articles.Content:
This has been much more noticeable since the last update.

In orbit.

No engines on.

No RCS on.

Only one set of reaction wheels in operation, including command pods, regardless of placement (nose, ctr or rear).

As my craft get larger, the more wobbly they are. It is almost like being on a ship at sea. The ship tries to say in one orientation but the sea moves beneath it causing the ship to slightly change orientation. I suspect after other instances of 'Wobbly Universe Syndrome' that the craft are, for the most part, fine but there must be some value or values in the physics of the universe itself which are drifting out, being corrected, and drifting out again.

Welcome to the Kraken @Daveroski. Not as much of a violent Kraken as many have seen, most likely a Youngling Kraken. The kraken is a weird bug in the physics of KSP which makes the parts in the craft wobble around, usually exploding. It's worse when you have SAS on, and even worse if you have a lot of torque modules. Although sometimes it'll just happen. There is no fix for it at the moment, and it is very temperamental for when it happens. It's more commonly known as "Phantom Forces".

Hope this helps,

ToTheMun

I remember the original Kraken fun times.

Are you clipping parts at all? Wobble does exist most of the time in KSP, but it isn't usually easy to notice. Orbits where the craft is travelling at low velocity (less than 350m/s) tend to experience it the worst, from what I've seen, but it can be exacerbated with certain combinations of physics-less parts and/or part clipping. Note that part clipping can happen from time to time even without the debug option enabled.

No, I am not clipping parts.

It's fairly easy to notice when you are trying to dock a fat heavy fuel tanker into a space station in a 80K orbit. Unless you compensate with huge amounts of RCS (and I don't) it always a fight just keeping the thing on target.

It should be just a matter of a little thrust here.. wait.. and a little thrust there.. the reaction wheels are supposed to keep you on your heading but they fight with a conflicted universe and can't agree on what is the correct heading, even if you are only using one set of reaction wheels, so it's necessary to wrestle the ship all the way.
